alert.note: Alert for Alexander (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 1:21PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Alexander and Catawba. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated just lingering showers. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen today and locally excessive runoff will be seen across tributaries of the Catawba and South Fork Catawba. Watch for out of bank conditions along Henry Fork, Lyle Creek and Little River among other select tributaries this afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will maintain minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
